messages.subject: Re: Can you help me solve this?
messages.msgSnippet: ~~ they collectively paid $9.33. $28/3.~~ No, they each paid $9 (or $27 total).  The problem is that you need to subtract the $2 the bellhop kept, not add it.
messages.messageBody:
~~
they collectively paid $9.33. $28/3.~~

No, they each paid $9 (or $27 total). The problem is that you need to
subtract the $2 the bellhop kept, not add it. The hotel actually
collected $25, not $30. The problem is set up to trick you into adding
the $2, rather than subtracting it which would make it correct.

Ren
learninginfreedom.com

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Can you help me solve this?
messages.msgSnippet: they collectively paid $9.33. $28/3. the bell kept the other $2, not the other way around. its just a play on words. ·´`·.(*·.¸(`·.¸
messages.messageBody:
they collectively paid $9.33. $28/3. the bell kept the other $2, not the other way around. its just a play on words.

Freedom to Fascism by Aaron Russo
http://video.google.com/videosearch?q=freedom+to+fascism

Hope for America
http://www.RonPaul2008.com
>
3 MEN GO INTO A MOTEL. THE MAN BEHIND THE DESK SAID THE ROOM IS $30,
SO EACH MAN PAID $10 AND WENT TO THE ROOM. A WHILE LATER THE MAN
BEHIND THE DESK REALIZED THE ROOM WAS ONLY $25, SO HE SENT THE
BELLBOY TO THE 3 GUYS' ROOM WITH $5. ON THE WAY, THE BELLBOY COULDN'T
FIGURE OUT HOW TO SPLIT $5 EVENLY BETWEEN 3 MEN, SO HE GAVE EACH MAN A
$1 AND KEPT THE OTHER $2 FOR HIMSELF. THIS MEANT THAT THE 3 MEN EACH
PAID $9 FOR THE ROOM, WHICH IS A TOTAL OF $27, ADD THE $2 THAT THE
BELLBOY KEPT = $29. WHERE IS THE OTHER DOLLAR?

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Can you help me solve this?
messages.msgSnippet: ... You can do a google search for things like this - lots of forums and blogs discuss puzzles. Try this page:
messages.messageBody:
On Dec 18, 2007 georgiashouse wrote:

> WHERE IS THE OTHER DOLLAR?



You can do a google search for things like this - lots of forums and blogs
discuss puzzles. Try this page:
http://stupidevilbastard.com/index/the_missing_dollar/

3 MEN GO INTO A MOTEL. THE MAN BEHIND THE DESK SAID THE ROOM IS $30,
SO EACH MAN PAID $10 AND WENT TO THE ROOM. A WHILE LATER THE MAN
BEHIND THE DESK REALIZED THE ROOM WAS ONLY $25, SO HE SENT THE
BELLBOY TO THE 3 GUYS' ROOM WITH $5. ON THE WAY, THE BELLBOY COULDN'T
FIGURE OUT HOW TO SPLIT $5 EVENLY BETWEEN 3 MEN, SO HE GAVE EACH MAN A
$1 AND KEPT THE OTHER $2 FOR HIMSELF. THIS MEANT THAT THE 3 MEN EACH
PAID $9 FOR THE ROOM, WHICH IS A TOTAL OF $27, ADD THE $2 THAT THE
BELLBOY KEPT = $29. WHERE IS THE OTHER DOLLAR?
